intro: Disparago hoffmanniana, commonly known as the Hoffmann's false dragonhead, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Disparago hoffmanniana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
